intro: Lautea collenettei var. denticulata, commonly known as the toothed lautea, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its unique foliage and floral structures. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are typically ovate with finely serrated margins, giving the plant its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they emit a mild fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
